item.title: How difficult is it to collect a sign from the road?, 25th July
item.description:
Fair play...the A frame is still there...you obviously have no interest in picking it up...let me know where to deliver it and I will move it for you......

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Huge subsidence in the road again, 25th July
item.description:
Yet again the road outside 50 Ryeworth Road is collapsing into itself. It was “repaired” a couple of years ago after a sink hole appeared and is just as bad again. I’m unable to pass this hole in the road as my car bottoms out. Please can this road defect be properly repaired rather than just patched.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Ryeworth Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The tree on the pavement outside number 19 Chatsworth drive, GL530AG has very low hanging branches. You have to duck to walk on the pavement. Its branches are also hanging over our property (no 19) and dropping crab apples on our front garden. Can someone cut it so you don’t have to duck under it and so it doesn’t overhang or am I allowed to do it? It is growing at an angle too. The crab apples drop everywhere, making a mess of the pavement and clog the drain on the road. It also attracts a lot of wasps. Could a different tree be planted at all? If not it definitely needs straightening and cutting back., 25th July
item.description:
The tree is outside number 19.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Chatsworth Drive, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large area of worn away road surface adjoining our drive on Mill Lane, 25th July
item.description:
Next to the drive of our house: Mill House, Mill Lane, Winchcombe GL54 5LT. Two other areas for remedial work have already been identified by the Highways Dept in Mill Lane. The road has been in this state since we moved to. the property in January 2024.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven, bumpy and dangerous, 25th July
item.description:
I passed this section of road on my motorcycle yesterday evening, coming home from work at 5pm. In traffic and even at 40/45 mph the road surface was so poor it caused me to have a near miss accident. The unevenness combined with ridges in the surface greatly unsettled my bike immediately before the right hand turn.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 25th July
item.description:
FMS report fwd by CBC 24.07.25 - Trees in front of bungalow have become a thicket which is invading my garden. truggling to cut back the thicket which is growing through my wire railings. A tree branch has grown across my land and is getting close to the roof. Originally there were two Holly trees but rowan trees grew in the middle of them followed by brambles. Seventeen years on it is a massive thicket which is completely out of control. It needs removing.
Report on FixMyStreet
